Давно знаком с этой игрой и в принципе на момент выхода она получилась очень хорошей и жуткой . Сам геймплей строиться на разгадке головоломок с кубами и телепортации . Только по развитию сюжета игра становится очень жуткой и не приятной . Давящее чувство одиночества так ещё в передачу странные надписи и фразы Гледос укрепляют это чувство . Разработчики решили что никак иначе лучше давить на игрока психологически и у них это хорошо получилось , давая задуматься что произошло на самом деле в месте где происходят основные действия .
Я рекомендую игру к ознакомлению с играми portal и любителям головоломок с необычным и жутким сюжетом .

This game was pretty good, I played it for about 10 hours, beat the story, got all the achievements and then I forgot about it. Some time has passed and now I learned how to beat the game in under 30 minutes and I had the time of my life. Speedrunning this game is really satisfying, but even if you don't plan on speedrunning I'd say it's worth the price on sale

Gerçekten mükemmel bir platform oyunu. Hikayesi bitti bana yetti, ileri düzeyleri var. Aynı bölümleri daha büyük zorluklarla oynamanızı sağlayacak bir seçeneği mevcut. Basit mekanikler ile kurulmuş ileri düzey fikirler ile çözülebilecek türden. 

Hikayenin sonunda çalan şarkı çok hoşuma gitti. Oyunu bir de ona karşı oynadığımız taraftan dinlemek bir hayli hoştu.

Game is really small (like 2 hours to finish the story and maybe 9 to get all the achievements), but its a nice intro to the portal series. The story puzzles are really easy but the challenge ones (the ones where they count the # of portals and stuff) are insanely difficulty.

Get the portal games in a bundle when they go on sale, definitely worth the money.

Do I really need to write this? It's portal. It's a classic. Come on.

1000% I recommend you this game. Portal 1 and 2 are childhood games for me -they are a pair, do not separate them. I played the original right out of 'The Orange Box' and beat it in maybe 6-10 hours spaced out across three days on my old beloved Xbox 360 (It was impressive for my age, I swear- the adults in my life we're impressed at how I beat it faster than they did). My disc of Portal 2 was broken when I was about halfway through the game, and like that disc, my heart was broken. Fast forward several years, and Portal catches my eye again -this time right here on Steam. It's on sale, along with its pair, Portal 2. I get both after a few heart-filled pleas for Steam money.
.
.
.
I proceed to beat both games in an afternoon.
Granted, I expected some fairly quick gameplay, being that many a moon had passed since I last thought about the game, but I surprised myself. Portal, despite being easier than I remember, was just as beautiful and pulled at the same heartstrings it did when I was but a young gamer. I cry when listening to 'Cara Mia Addio' and no I'm not afraid to admit it. I feel like I'm connecting to something I was sure I had lost when I play the Portal franchise.
So what are you waiting for? Buy the game. buy 'em both. I don't think your heart will be touched exactly the way mine was- heck, I doubt anyone has my exact experience with this franchise- but no matter what, it's a touching game and by god if it hasn't changed the way I look at gaming as a whole, then I'm not me.
Happy testing :]
It's hard to overstate my satisfaction © Still Alive

[h1]At-A-Glance:[/h1]
[b]Game type:[/b] Puzzle
[b]Genre(s):[/b] Science fiction, humor
[b]Art:[/b] 3D Rendering
[b]Length:[/b] Short (3-4 hours)
[b]Pace:[/b] Fast-paced
[b]Tags:[/b] Abstract, hilarious writing, subversive, action, puzzle
[b]Computer requirements:[/b] Low-end


[h1]Notes:[/h1]
[olist]
[*] So much has been written about [i]Portal[/i] that it'll feel weird for me to attempt any recapitulation in these notes.
[*] The game really is a master class in level design. The slow progression in puzzle difficulty through the portal gun, turrets, jumping mechanics, etc. is fascinating in how you go from simply learning how to walk through a puzzle to timing momentum changes for hitting a secret area... all in about 2-3 hours of gameplay. Making players [i]feel[/i] like they are experts in pushing your game's boundaries through simulated environments and carefully constructed environmental instruction must be commended - and it's why [i]Portal[/i] holds up so well today.
[*] If you've been spoiled by the ending (and you probably have if you've heard anything about this game since it came out), then don't worry - it's still hilarious, and it still is mildly subversive in impressive ways.
[*] The back half of the game [spoiler]encourages you to try and break the game despite it being obvious it is just as carefully constructed.[/spoiler] That kind of aesthetic comes back in a big way in [i]Portal 2[/i], and it was also a big part of the signposting of [i]Half-Life 2[/i]. In general, Valve games tend to encourage emergent playing in a way that inspires a "Whoa, can I do this? *Did* I do this???" feeling like no other.
[*] If you are even tangentially interested in video games, you should get this. [i]Portal[/i] is one of those games I consider an unqualified recommendation to anyone remote interested in gaming as a platform - be that narrative, action-oriented, or brain teaser.
[/olist]

have you ever wanted to bang a robot?

Hi, so, I'm very late to this, I know, but I just got this game and finished it.

First, it doesn't take much time to complete, but isn't short. If you have a few hours, you'll beat it in one day. Just the right length. Second, while it may not seem there's much secrets or any story, I found 2 hidden rooms with some person obsessed over the Companion Cube. Also, the story's pretty interesting. however, you don't hear much of it until the very last part, which makes the game feel a little dragged on and boring after a while. Also, the credit song I loved. So, it's a rather good game. Good for... [i][b]2007!?[/b][/i]

Final Rating: 85-89%
Verdict: Good game, good story, rather boring until the last chapter unless you love IQ testing games.

I got it during the Black Friday deal bundled with Portal 2 for like 5 dollars which is a really good deal, it's a lot shorter than Portal 2 but is still really confusing and fun, if you see it on sale or REALLY want to play it it is definitely worth it.

Just Finished Portal, It's Still A Fun Puzzle Game After All These Years. Although There's Some Issues In Some Of The Chambers But These Issues Are Quite Rare, And Most Of These Chambers Are Fine And Great. They're Fun And Really Gives You The Aha! Feeling. Overall, I Recommend This Old School Puzzle Game.
